['Hammer – A primary tool used by carpenters for driving nails into wood or other materials.', 'Tape Measure – Essential for taking accurate measurements in any carpentry project.', 'Chisels – Used for cutting and shaping wood, chisels come in various sizes for different tasks.', 'Saw – A variety of saws are used depending on the job, including hand saws or power saws like circular saws.', 'Plane – For smoothing surfaces and sizing boards correctly.', 'Level – Ensures that projects are perfectly horizontal or vertical.', 'Square – Used to mark out right angles for precise cuts and alignments.', 'Screwdrivers – Various types including flathead and Phillips head screwdrivers, used for driving screws into wood.', 'Drill – Both corded and cordless drills are common tools for making holes in materials.', 'Clamps – Used to hold pieces of material firmly together while glue sets or when cutting is being done.', "Carpenter's pencil – A specialized pencil with a flat edge, used for marking cut lines on wood.", 'Miter Box and Saw – Allows for making precise crosscuts at specific angles.', 'Workbench – An essential piece of equipment to secure materials while working on them.', 'Bandsaw – For cutting curves or resawing boards, offering more precision than a handsaw.', 'Nail Setter – Helps drive nails below the wood surface for finishing work.', 'Wood Glue – Adhesive used to bond pieces of wood together.', 'Safety Glasses – Protects eyes from dust and debrebris while working with power tools or cutting materials.', 'Ear Protection – Necessary when using loud power tools to prevent hearing damage.', 'Dust Mask or Respirator – To protect the lungs from sawdust during woodworking projects.', 'Work Gloves – Provide a better grip and protection for hands while handling materials.']
